fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36850].
  {panel}

We have begun using tasks extensively in our Confluence instance (especially in meeting notes!).

When a user marks a task complete, all watchers receive a notification. This is good, and expected functionality.

The issue is that the notification sent (at least in 5.6.3) is rather unclear about which exact task was marked complete. The notification shows the entire list of tasks, with some very subtle formatting showing the one task marked complete. 

When there are many tasks on a list, some checked and some unchecked, it can become very confusing to know which task has been marked complete.

For example, see the attached PDF - one of the tasks was marked complete, which one was it? (Hint, it's on page 3).

Ideally, the formatting in the notification email would be much more visible for task marked completed, or alternatively the tasks marked complete would be the only tasks showing (although I do like seeing the entire list as it motivates other users to close their tasks...!).
fields.summary: Confluence task marked complete notifcation emails should be clearer
Add priority arrow emoticons

fields.description:
h2. Problem:

Certain cache's have 100% Capacity Utilization so I am trying to allot more space to them but I am unable to.  I go to General Configuration > Cache Management > Advanced View > Adjust Size.  When this prompt comes up requesting the amount of elements to give to the cache, I enter the amount I want but the submit does nothing.  It doesn't do this for all of the cache's but it does for some.  The caches in particular are listed below:

Application Links
Atlassian White List Service Switch Enabled
HipChat discovery cache
HipChat links cache
HostLicenseCache
Notification Server Configuration Cache


I was doing performance tuning and this is inhibiting me from having all my caches with less than 75% utilization. 

h3. Workaround:

Located the cache-settings-overrides.properties file in \Atlassian\Application Data\Confluence\shared-home\config. I noticed that when you hover over a cache name in General Configuration > Cache Management , it shows its “real” name. So I just mimicked the way this file created the overrides I was able to do for other cache’s, and did the same thing for the caches that were not submitting the change.
fields.summary: Unable to Adjust Size of certain cache's
Handling the attachment file in comment separately

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36846].
  {panel}

The tasking features within confluence are nice and have been useful.  It would be better of the task macro can display tasks based on a topic or label (hastag).
* Assignment works with @
* duedate works with //
* label or topic could use #hashtag

Then the task macro could filter or sort based on the topic, confluence page, space, date, or assignee.
fields.summary: Improve task functionality with hashtag

Notable bug-fixes and improvements:

* Layers
* Print improvements
* Shape style copy & paste
* Save As
** Save Gliffy diagrams to new and existing Confluence pages directly from the Gliffy editor
* Diagram preview images in revision history
* High-resolution image export
* Shapes as links
* Android shapes
* Improved network shapes
* Diagram version pinning
** Specify the published version of a diagram using this new feature. When editing a Confluence page, select the Gliffy diagram macro, and click the "Version" button to specify the published/pinned version of a diagram.

* Diagram import improvements
* Improved drawing guides
* Image panel improvements
* Full-screen viewer security vulnerability fix
* Fix for Firefox JS IndexSizeError
* Fix for link color rendering on legacy diagrams
* Numerous other bug fixes and stability improvements
* Some resources served from a CDN when in OnDemand / Cloud

fields.description:
*Bug Description*

When a user try to create a space in Confluence with the same Space ID as existing space *that the user have no access*, Confluence will deactivate the "Create" button without any error message.

This could cause confusion to the user as there are no information provided on why it is not possible to create a space.

*How to Replicate*

# Create user A with "Create Space" permission
# Login with user A and create a *private* space with space ID : A
# Logout and access Confluence using administrator user
# Create user B with "Create Space" permission
# Login with user B and try to create a space with space ID : A

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should throw error message that inform user that it can't create a space using the proposed space id. It is not necessary to inform user that there is a space using the same id, however Confluence should inform why it failed so user could modify it.

*Resulted Behaviour*

Create button looks active, however there are no indication why Confluence unable to create the space as can be seen in the screenshot below:

!create.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating 2 spaces with same ID doesn't produce any error

fields.description:
When exporting a page to HTML which includes others, the page will not include the attachments on that sub page, nor will it adjust the links. 

Exporting of the space, and selecting the page and the included ones still does not work, as the image links point to /confluence/ rather than to the correct location on disk.

So when a page is included it needs to somehow include all the attachments and rewrite the image urls during export.

Steps to reproduce:

#     Create a page (PAGE A) containing links to other pages within the same space. Links are created with the Search option in the Create link dialog.
#     On another page (PAGE B) include PAGE A using the Include Page/Multiexcerpt/Navigation Map macro.
#     Export space to HTML
#     Unzip the export file
#     Observe that links on PAGE A point to extracted html files while links on PAGE B point to https pages of your Confluence instance

The same happens when using the Multiexcerpt plugin instead of Page Include.

This also happens for Navigation Map Macro:
# Actual "html-test" page in Confluence:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Navigating to page "1" that is listed in the *Navigation Map Macro* in Confluence:
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Exported HTML of "html-test" page:
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# Navigating to page "1" that is listed in the *Navigation Map Macro* in Exported HTML file:
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Export of page which includes other pages contains broken links

fields.description:
*Bug Information*

When Confluence is installed in CentOS 6.6, its file preview feature unable to render special character such as Russian characters. This issue is not reproducible in Confluence installed in Windows and Mac OS X.

*How to Replicate*

# Installed Confluence in CentOS 6.6
# Attached a file contain Russian character
# Render it using {{viewoffice}} and preview

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence able to render the file using both macros.

*Resulted Behaviour*

Confluence *successfully render the page using {{viewoffice}} macro* but unable to render the character using Preview feature. Instead, Confluence replace the character to squares as can be seen in the screenshot below:

!square.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

# Install *dejavu-sans-fonts* package in CentOS 6.6 and reattach the attachments.
# Shutdown Confluence
# [Clear plugin cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Clear+Confluence+Plugins+Cache]
# Remove the content of {{<CONF_HOME_Dir>/shared-home/}}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Preview Unable to Render Special Character for CentOS 6.6 Installation

fields.description:
We have several users in home office who have to work with our internal confluence instance. So they got VPN to use it. It works fine, BUT they cannot write comments.
Every time they press on the "Comment"-Frame, Confluence try to load the Editor and won't finish.
It appears a grey frame "Loading the Editor". In the Browser console (Firebug and IE), I got an error "Confluence.Editor is undefined". Searching the DOM shows me, that this object isn't initiated if I will connect via VPN. Connecting in our DMZ works and the object "Confluence.Editor" is accessible.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create an XML space export from old version of Confluence. For example Confluence version prior than Confluence 5.x
# Import it in Confluence 5.6.5 

*What Happens*
# The space backup could not be restored *which is an expected behavior*. (See other notes below)
# The following error(s) occurred:
#* From Confluence version 4 and above
{code}
Backups made prior to Confluence 4.0 (build 3047) can not be restored. This backups build number was missing.
{code}
#* From Confluence prior to 2.7.4
{code}
Backups made prior to Confluence 2.7.4 (build 1117) can not be restored. This backup had build number 813.
{code}

*What is expected*
# Something related to space export-import across major release is not allowed
# The above error is misleading as the backup was not made "prior to Confluence 4.0"

h6. Other notes:
# Confluence does not support major release space backup, as per this  [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Site]
bq. Confluence supports importing site and space backups into the same major version only. In Confluence,
# Workaround to restore spaces from an earlier major releases provided from the documentation below:
* [Workaround for restoring spaces between major releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Space#RestoringaSpace-Workaroundforrestoringspacesbetweenmajorreleases]
fields.summary: When restoring XML space backup from a previous major release, a misleading error is thrown

fields.description:
This ticket is being opened as a possible regression of this case:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30711

On certain PDF files that contains graphics, the JVM crashes when you try to set a PDF View File Macro to view the file, exactly as the bug noted above.

This was tested on Confluence 5.1.5 and 5.7, using the JDK 1.7.0_75 and JDK 1.8.0_40.

h3. Workaround
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.7
# Disable the viewpdf macro:
#- Go to Confluence Admin > Manage Add ons
#- Select System add ons from the drop down
#- Search for Office Connector
#- Expand the modules
#- Disable the {{viewpdf}} and {{viewpdf-legacy}} modules
# Now you will be able to view the page without it crashing
# Edit the page and use the new Files thumbnail viewer to display the file, by going to Insert > Files and Attachments, and selecting the PDF
#- For more information see 'Displaying a file as a thumbnail or a link' [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Displaying+Files+and+Images#DisplayingFilesandImages-DisplayingOfficefilesandPDFs]
# Re-enable the {{viewpdf}} and {{viewpdf-legacy}} modules of the Office Connector if desired
fields.summary: Old PDF viewer (pre 5.6) crashes the JVM on specific PDF files
The error message trying to restore a backup is misleading.

- Confluence should have an additional feature that limits a user or groups to a max allotted downloads or views of attachments.

- Limit the content downloaded or viewed by certain users

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.6 and beyond, we can specify the "zoom" level for a logo to help it fit into the circle placeholder a bit easier. The discussion for this was covered in CONF-28275, and was shipped in Confluence 5.6.

However, this doesn't apply to spaces that use the Documentation Theme. These spaces still use the old method of uploading a space logo, and cannot specify the zoom level.

h5.Workaround:
# Swap your space to the "Default" theme
# In the sidebar, click "Space Tools" followed by "Configure Sidebar". Then, click on the Pencil next to the space icon and title
# Upload your desired space logo, and use the zoom controls to size it as appropriate. You can drag the logo around to reposition where the circle sits
# Click "Save"
# With your logo displaying correctly (or at least not chopped off), you can swap the space back to the Documentation Theme.
fields.summary: When using the documentation theme, space logos are rounded by default

fields.description:
Symptoms:

Some users fail to receive some page, or blog post notifications. It seems to happen sporadically, but consistently for a specific space.

Potential cause:

The notifications plugin queues up emails with a retry mechanism. This retry attempts to re-send to a recipient when failure happens for whatever reason. This includes failure to verify the email address validity (e.g., a user has a blank, or empty email address).

The retry does not remove the currently failing recipient, and re-queues the notification, causing it to fail next time (for the same reason). After a set number of failures, the entire batch of recipients is discarded, and thus some recipients (who does have valid email address) fail to receive any email.

Workaround:
Find the offending user (user with no/invalid email address) by going to the Manage watcher dialog on the page, and remove them, or add a valid email address.
fields.summary: Some Email Notifications fail to send, if  one of the users in the list of users receiving them has an invalid email address

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36799].
  {panel}

We LOVE The Macro but it can make your Confluence Page Ugly!

*Background*
Teams who collect formal requirements and need to provide Change management need to be able to track the individual change of requirements.   to meet this requirement, we are creating requirements in JIRA and inserting them in Confluence to provide the big picture. 

For example, we have issues type for User Action, System Action, System Response and business Rules.  we use these issue types to create the traditional Use Case requirements for compliance.  Opposed to having text published in confluence the  document is made up of JIRA issues inserted into the table.   Teams complain that the issue ID and Status are distracting and the table view adds an unnecessary header.

*Acceptance Criteria* 
# When viewing a List of Issues, Allow the Table Header to be Hidden
# When Viewing an individual issue, allow the all issue attributes to be hidden. 
## Text would appear like inline comments 
## Hovering over would show the issue details.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Issues Macro Formatting Options

fields.description:
Page containing numbered lists exports to Word only has numbers. The sub-lists should be letters or roman numerals, but appear only as numbers. 

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Create a new page.
# Add numbered lists that contains sub-lists with letters and roman numerals.
# Export to Word

h3. Expected behavior
Expected the exported word document to contain the sub-lists as shown in Confluence.

h3. Actual behavior
The exported word document only has numbers for the sub-lists. Missing the letters and roman numerals.

h3. Related Notes
* Export to PDF has the sub-lists correctly with letters and roman numerals.
fields.summary: Export to Word Does Not Export Sub-Lists Correctly

Hello,

Trying to upload an image in Confluence 5.7, I have an issue on with a PNG.
The upload progress bar reach 100% but stay stucked afterwards.
After further analysis, it is because it was in RGB32. After converted it to RGB24, the upload worked.

Note: directly drag and drop the image to the confluence page ,worked with RGB32 but after this is was not possible to add any effect afterwards.

Find in attachement the original RGB32 PNG, the copy after RGB24 convertion and the side-by-side comnparison of the upload result.

- Specify text style of "Table of contents" macro to Heading

This problem doesn't happen in 5.7.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36776].
  {panel}

Current version of Gliffy for Confluence packaged with Cloud Confluence is 6.3.2. Do we have plans to update this to the latest release which is 6.5.1?

The newest version contains quite a few features that would be a great benefit to users of the plugin as well as fixes.

6.5.1 contains the following bug fixes:

Full-screen viewer loading/rendering speed improvements.
"data-pageid" text sometimes appears on Confluence page above Gliffy macro.
IE9 JS error: TypeError: object doesn't support property or method 'pushState'.
Browser page navigation dialog sometimes appears after exiting the Gliffy editor.
Fixes and improvements around diagram version pinning.
Diagram import improvements.
fields.summary: Update the Gliffy plugin to newest version in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36775].
  {panel}

When restricting a page in confluence, you can choose *any* user to be able to view the page. But if a certain user is not able to see a superior page due to the restrictions of the superior page, this setting has no effect: he can not see the page although he *seems* to be allowed.

I see 2 possibilities:
a) the user should be able to see the page although he is "blocked" by the superior page
b) when setting restrictions for a page, confluence should only "offer" people, that whould be able to see the page depending on the restrictions of all superior pages

... I would prefer option b!
fields.summary: Show only possible page restrictions

fields.description:
The {html} macro is slightly broken if you enter it using the "just type the curly brackets" method. Eg., if I type \{code}, a code block pops up. But if I type \{html} I get a wiki markup block with the text string \{html} inside.

The workaround is to NOT type the closing } curly bracket but instead you must lift your hand off the keyboard, go for the mouse and select HTML from the pop-up menu.
fields.summary: Entering HTML macro activates a wiki markup block

h4. Problem
Currently, if you have a list of pages, for example:

0xA10A
0xA10B
0xA10C
0xA100
0xA101
0xA102
0xA103

When sorting alphabetically in Move and Reorder Pages, it will sort them as above, and there is no option to configure otherwise, other than doing a Manual Sort.

h4. Suggestion
Provide option to create a custom sort, such as 0123456789ABCDEF... etc. rather than ABCDEF0123456789

Example desired sort order:

0xA100
0xA101
0xA102
0xA103
0xA10A
0xA10B
0xA10C
fields.summary: Ability to sort pages numbers before letters alphabetically
Task Report Macro | Sort Values

fields.description:
Steps:

# Install with Custom Install option
# Next and next until you see "Set custom value for HTTP and Control port"
# Set Control Port Number which different with 8000 (ex: set 8888)

fields.description:
When I add the Recently Updated Dashboard macro to a page, and add a user, there are fewer results in the 'All Updates' tab the first time I view it compared with every subsequent time. For example, I go to the page and see the *All Updates* tab, which has 8 results; then I click the *Network* tab and return to the *All Updates* tab and there are 11 results returned.

This happens every time I visit the page. Seems like the extra results all contain the user that I added to the macro.

Steps to reproduce:
# Add the Recently Updated Dashboard macro to a page, and add a user
# Save the page and navigate away from it
# Navigate back to the page and view the *All Updates* tab (record the number of results)
# Click the *Network* tab
# Click the *All Updates* tab

The number of results will be different if my experience is replicated.
fields.summary: Recently Updated Dashboard macro returns inconsistent results
Update references from 'Optimise Indexing' to 'Clean Journal Entries' in CAC docs
Glossary Plug In

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36759].
  {panel}

When you change any content inside a section area, confluence notification system does not crop the content around the edited area.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Have a Confluence with a mail server configured.
# Create a page with the following structure:
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
# Now under section change the "lot's of content" to " Changing content".
# You will get a mail notification as the following one:
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) Which is expected.
# Now click on the page layout icon and add 3 blocks, then copy and paste your section into each block:
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save it.
# Edit again and change the section 2 "Changing Content" to "Changing Again"
# You will get the entire section block instead of crop the edited area:
!img4.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Mail notification message does not crop to edited items when using sections

fields.description:
The gallery macro slideshow no longer filters images by label.  The images first displayed on a page are filtered, but once you click on a thumbnail to zoom to a screen sized image and enter the slideshow, once you keep clicking the right arrow you will be shown all images attached to a page regardless of label/filter.

Steps to reproduce:

# Add several attachments to a page.  
# Save the page, go to Tools > Attachments > and add two different labels to the images.
# Edit the page and add the Gallery Macro.  
# Exclude or Include (or both) by label
# Save the page.
# Click on one of the thumbnails to enter the slideshow.
# Click to the right and you will be shown all images regardless of label.

This is reproducible in 5.7, but not in 5.6.4.
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Slideshow No Longer Filters Images
